title: Selling Bottles to Rebalance a Collection
metaTitle: Selling Bottles to Rebalance Your Wine or Whiskey Collection | Proof Cellars
metaDescription: How to decide which bottles to sell when rebalancing your collection. Covers choosing what to sell, minimizing regret, and maintaining condition and packaging.
summary: Collections evolve. Tastes change, space fills up, and sometimes it makes sense to sell bottles you no longer want to drink or hold. This guide covers how to approach rebalancing thoughtfully.

sections.heading: What to Do Next
content: Start by identifying bottles you are unlikely to drink. This might include wines past their peak, duplicates, styles you no longer enjoy, or bottles bought for investment rather than consumption.
Check condition and packaging. Bottles with intact original packaging typically command higher prices.
list: Review your collection and identify candidates for sale
Check fill levels and label condition on target bottles
Locate original wood cases, tubes, or boxes
Create a list of what you want to sell
Submit photos and list for an offer

sections.heading: What Information Matters for Pricing
content: We value bottles based on current market demand, condition, and packaging.
list: Producer names and vintages
Quantities
Bottle sizes
Original packaging status
Storage history if relevant to provenance
Condition notes (fill levels, label condition)

sections.heading: Common Mistakes to Avoid
content: Selling bottles impulsively, then regretting it. Take time to think about what you genuinely want to keep.
Overvaluing bottles based on what you paid rather than current market. Prices fluctuate and some bottles depreciate.
list: Selling bottles you will later wish you had kept
Expecting to get retail prices (buyers pay wholesale)
Separating bottles from original packaging before sale
Not checking condition before listing
Selling only your lowest value bottles and keeping problem inventory

sections.heading: How the Process Works
content: Submit what you want to sell and we provide an offer. You are not obligated to sell everything you submit.
list: Submit photos and inventory through our form or text to 213-770-9463
We provide a written offer within one to three business days
Review and decide which bottles you actually want to sell
If you accept, we coordinate pickup or shipping
Payment is issued after we receive and verify the bottles

sections.heading: Privacy and Safety Notes
content: Rebalancing sales are handled discreetly. We do not disclose seller information.
You can sell as few or as many bottles as you like. There is no minimum.
Getting an offer does not obligate you to sell. Use it to inform your decisions.

faqs.question: What should I consider selling?
faqs.answer: Bottles you are unlikely to drink: past their peak, not your current taste, duplicates, or bottles you bought for investment and want to realize gains on.

faqs.question: Is there a minimum quantity?
faqs.answer: No minimum. We buy single bottles or large quantities.

faqs.question: What if I'm not sure about some bottles?
faqs.answer: Get an offer first. You can decide which bottles to actually sell after seeing the values.

faqs.question: Do bottles need to be in original cases?
faqs.answer: Not required, but original cases often increase value. If you have them, include them.

faqs.question: How do you determine value?
faqs.answer: We base offers on current market demand, recent sale prices, condition, and packaging. Values can be higher or lower than what you paid.

faqs.question: Can I sell from professional storage directly?
faqs.answer: Yes. We can coordinate with your storage facility where permitted.
